text: Suppression of signals required for activation of transcription factor NF-kappa B in cells constitutively expressing the HTLV-I <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein .

Transient short-term expression of the <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein of human T-cell leukemia virus type-I ( HTLV-I ) leads to activation of the pleiotropic transcription factor NF-kappa B . Consistent with findings obtained with transient expression assays , we observed marked accumulation of the transcription factor NF-kappa B in the nucleus of Namalwa B lymphoid cells , which constitutively express <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: In contrast , NF-kappa B activity was not detected in the nucleus following long-term expression of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in Jurkat T lymphocytes .
The ability of both mitogens and cytokines to activate NF-kappa B was also blocked in Jurkat cells constitutively expressing <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

However , the activation of other mitogen - inducible transcription factors , such as <extra_id_0> Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , was unaffected .

text: Thus , depending on the cellular environment , the short - and long-term effects of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression can be quite different .

text: Consequently , one function of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in cells infected with HTLV-I might involve cell-type - specific suppression , as opposed to activation , of distinct signal pathways .
The cells lines described here should be useful for the delineation of signaling pathways utilized in the selective regulation of gene expression .
